item.title: Newsmax 以 6700 万美元和解 Dominion 诽谤案，称无法获得公平审判
item.description: Newsmax Media 公司周一表示，已同意向 Dominion 投票系统公司支付 6700 万美元，以了结一起价值 16 亿美元的诽谤诉讼案。【原文：Newsmax Media has agreed to pay $67 million to Dominion Voting Systems to settle a $1.6 billion defamation lawsuit over false claims that the voting machine company rigged the 2020 election against U.S. President Donald Trump, it said on Monday.】

item.title: 黑石咖啡吧公开提交美国 IPO 申请
item.description: 咖啡连锁店 Black Rock Coffee Bar 周一公布了在美国首次公开募股的文件。【原文：Coffee chain Black Rock Coffee Bar made public its paperwork for an initial public offering in the U.S. on Monday.】

item.title: 乌克兰称美国投资基金代表团将于 9 月来访
item.description: 基辅经济部长周一表示，负责与美国联合投资基金的乌克兰官员正在为美国同行 9 月份的访问做准备。【原文：Ukrainian officials working on a joint investment fund with the U.S. are preparing for a visit by their American counterparts in September, Kyiv's economy minister said on Monday.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，特朗普政府将讨论收购英特尔 10% 的股份
item.description: 彭博新闻社周一援引一名白宫官员和其他熟悉内情的人士的话报道说，特朗普政府正在讨论入股美国芯片制造商英特尔公司（Intel）10%的股份。【原文：The Trump administration is said to discuss taking a 10% stake in American chipmaker Intel , Bloomberg News reported on Monday, citing a White House official and other people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国联邦贸易委员会起诉门票转售商逃避泰勒-斯威夫特 Eras 巡演门票限制
item.description: 美国联邦贸易委员会周一向马里兰州联邦法院提起诉讼，控告门票转售商 Key Investment Group 规避购买限制，购买数千张现场活动门票，包括泰勒-斯威夫特（Taylor Swift）的 Eras 巡演门票，并加价转售。【原文：The U.S. Federal Trade Commission sued ticket reseller Key Investment Group for evading purchasing limits to buy up thousands of tickets to live events including Taylor Swift's Eras tour and resell them at a markup, according to a complaint filed in Maryland federal court on Monday.】

item.title: 碧桂园海外债务重组获银行债权团支持
item.description: 陷入困境的中国房地产开发商碧桂园周一表示，已与持有其 49% 境外债务的核心银行债权人集团达成协议，标志着其 141 亿美元的重组计划又迈出了一步。【原文：Embattled Chinese property developer Country Garden said on Monday it had reached an agreement with a core group of bank creditors that holds 49% of its offshore debt, marking another step in its $14.1 billion restructuring plan.】

item.title: 参议员希望联邦通信委员会披露特朗普是否在派拉蒙合并审查期间寻求改变内容
item.description: 民主党参议员亚当-希夫（Adam Schiff）要求联邦通信委员会负责人披露，唐纳德-特朗普总统是否在批准哥伦比亚广播公司母公司派拉蒙全球公司（Paramount Global）与天舞传媒公司（Skydance Media）合并的过程中寻求节目制作或媒体报道承诺。【原文：Democratic Senator Adam Schiff asked the head of the Federal Communications Commission to disclose if President Donald Trump sought programming or media coverage commitments as part of the approval of CBS-parent Paramount Global's merger with Skydance Media.】

item.title: 前新罕布什尔州州长将领导美国航空游说集团
item.description: 前新罕布什尔州州长克里斯-苏努努（Chris Sununu）放弃了竞选 2026 年美国参议员的机会，该集团周一表示，他将领导贸易集团美国航空（Airlines for America）。【原文：Former New Hampshire Governor Chris Sununu, who passed up a chance to run for the U.S. Senate in 2026, will lead the trade group Airlines for America, the group said Monday.】

item.title: 贝莱德的 GIP 将入股埃尼公司的碳捕集业务
item.description: 意大利埃尼公司周一表示，美国资产管理公司贝莱德（BlackRock）旗下的基础设施基金 GIP 已同意购买该公司碳捕集与封存业务（CCUS）49.99% 的股份，但未透露价格。【原文：U.S. asset manager BlackRock's infrastructure fund GIP has agreed to buy a 49.99% stake in Eni's carbon capture and storage business (CCUS), the Italian company said on Monday without disclosing the price.】

item.title: 美国住宅建筑商情绪回落至 2022 年底以来最低水平
item.description: 8 月份，美国住宅建筑商的信心指数意外下滑，跌至两年半以来的最低水平，超过三分之一的住宅建筑公司下调了价格，约三分之二的公司提供了某种形式的激励措施，以吸引因抵押贷款利率居高不下和经济不确定性而被冷落的购房者。【原文：A gauge of U.S. homebuilder sentiment fell unexpectedly in August, slipping back to its lowest level in more than two-and-a-half years, with more than a third of residential construction firms cutting prices and roughly two-thirds of them offering some form of incentive to lure buyers sidelined by still-high mortgage rates and economic uncertainty.】

item.title: 谷歌研究显示，近 90% 的电子游戏开发商使用人工智能代理
item.description: 谷歌云的一项调查显示，87% 的电子游戏开发商正在使用人工智能代理来简化和自动化任务，因为在创纪录的裁员浪潮之后，该行业正专注于优化成本。【原文：A Google Cloud survey showed that 87% of videogame developers are using artificial intelligence agents to streamline and automate tasks, as the industry focuses on optimizing costs following a wave of record layoffs.】

item.title: Yext 首席执行官提出以 11 亿美元将公司私有化
item.description: Yext公司首席执行官迈克尔-沃尔拉特（Michael Walrath）周一表示，已提议将这家搜索优化公司私有化，交易价值约为11亿美元，这使得该公司股价在早盘交易中上涨了9%。【原文：Yext's CEO Michael Walrath has proposed taking the search optimization company private in a deal valued at about $1.1 billion, it said on Monday, sending shares up 9% in early trading.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，有线电视网 MSNBC 在计划分拆之前将改名为 MS NOW
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周一报道，在母公司康卡斯特旗下 NBCUniversal 有线电视网计划于今年晚些时候分拆大部分业务之前，有线电视新闻频道 MSNBC 将改名为 My Source News Opinion World，即 MS NOW。【原文：Cable news channel MSNBC will rebrand as My Source News Opinion World, or MS NOW, ahead of the planned spinoff of the bulk of parent Comcast's NBCUniversal cable networks later this year, the Wall Street Journal reported on Monday.】

item.title: 花旗银行主管通过增加高管、交易和合作推动扭亏为盈
item.description: 据知情人士、分析师和公开数据显示，维斯瓦斯-拉加万（Viswas Raghavan）的招聘热潮和对更多内部合作的推动，正在帮助花旗集团的投资银行业务在华尔街的排名不断攀升。【原文：Viswas Raghavan's hiring spree and push for more internal cooperation are helping Citigroup's investment banking business climb the Wall Street rankings, according to sources, analysts and public data.】

item.title: 英国汽车金融裁决可能促进并购
item.description: 英国最高法院的一项裁决可能会为汽车金融公司节省数十亿美元的赔偿金，这将为该行业的整合浪潮扫清障碍。【原文：A ruling from the United Kingdom's top court that will likely save car finance companies billions in compensation payouts could clear the way for a wave of consolidation in the sector.】

item.title: 安费诺以 10 亿美元收购 Trexon，扩大防务产品组合
item.description: 电子设备制造商安费诺（Amphenol）周一表示，将以约 10 亿美元现金收购电缆组装公司 Trexon。【原文：Amphenol will buy cable assembly firm Trexon for about $1 billion in cash, the electronic equipment maker said on Monday, as it aims to tap into rising defense spending and expand its military-focused product portfolio.】

item.title: 诺和诺德将以每月 499 美元的价格发售 Ozempic
item.description: 诺和诺德（Novo Nordisk）周一表示，该公司正在为自费的 2 型糖尿病患者推出一项新优惠，每月只需支付 499 美元即可获得正品 Ozempic。【原文：Novo Nordisk said on Monday that it was launching a new offer for self-paying type 2 diabetes patients to access authentic Ozempic for $499 per month.】

item.title: 谷歌宣布田纳西州为小型模块化核反应堆选址地
item.description: 谷歌（Google）和凯罗斯电力公司（Kairos Power）周一表示，谷歌已选定田纳西州作为先进核电站的选址，该核电站预计将于 2030 年开始为这家大型科技公司在美国东南部的数据中心供电。【原文：Google , with Kairos Power, has selected Tennessee as the site of an advanced nuclear power plant that is expected to supply electricity to the Big Tech company's data centers in the U.S. southeast starting in 2030, the companies said on Monday.】

item.title: 特斯拉在中国社交媒体发文称 Model Y L "即将上市
item.description: 特斯拉周一在中国社交媒体平台微博上发文称，其Model Y L "即将上市"，此前特斯拉已计划在中国推出这款新型六座电动汽车。【原文：Tesla said in a post on the Chinese social media platform Weibo on Monday that its Model Y L was "coming soon", having previously registered plans to introduce the new six-seater electric vehicle in China.】

item.title: 出口商协会称象牙海岸 7 月可可产量同比下降 31.2
item.description: 出口商协会GEPEX周一提供的数据显示，象牙海岸7月份的可可产量同比下降了31.2%，降至39301公吨。【原文：Ivory Coast's cocoa grind dropped 31.2% year-on-year in July to 39,301 metric tons, data from exporters' association GEPEX showed on Monday, with grinders citing poor bean quality and low volumes of the mid-crop.】

item.title: Eletrobras 与 C3 AI 合作实现巴西电网现代化
item.description: 巴西电力公司 Eletrobras 周一告诉路透社，两家公司已与 C3 AI 合作，应用人工智能帮助运营拉丁美洲最大经济体的电力传输网络。【原文：Brazilian power company Eletrobras has partnered with C3 AI to apply artificial intelligence to help operate the electric power transmission network in Latin America's largest economy, the two companies told Reuters on Monday.】

item.title: 美国滞胀风险对世界市场意味着什么
item.description: 美国滞胀的阴影笼罩着全球市场，导致一些投资者调整投资组合，以规避关税可能对世界主要经济体的增长和通胀造成的潜在损害。【原文：The spectre of U.S. stagflation is stalking global markets, causing some investors to position portfolios to dodge the potential damage that tariffs could wreak on growth and inflation in the world's dominant economy.】

item.title: 德国称欧盟与美国的书面贸易协议要求降低汽车关税
item.description: 德国周一表示，在以书面形式敲定更广泛的贸易协议之前，美国必须落实降低欧洲制造汽车关税的协议。【原文：Germany said on Monday that the United States would have to follow through on agreed lower tariffs on Europe-made cars before a wider agreement on trade can be finalised in writing.】

item.title: 早间竞标：泽连斯基（与朋友）返回华盛顿
item.description: 欧洲金融市场编辑 Dhara Ranasinghe 对美国和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets by Dhara Ranasinghe, European Financial Markets Editor】

item.title: 挪威财富基金将六家与西岸和加沙有关联的公司排除在外
item.description: 挪威主权财富基金是世界上最大的主权财富基金，该基金周一表示，在对其在以色列的投资进行道德审查后，决定将另外六家与约旦河西岸和加沙地带有关联的公司排除在其投资组合之外。【原文：Norway's sovereign wealth fund, the world's largest, said on Monday it had decided to exclude another six companies with connections to the West Bank and Gaza from its portfolio, following an ethics review of its Israeli investments.】

item.title: 华尔街期货低迷，关注零售商盈利和美联储研讨会
item.description: 美国股指期货周一震荡，在近期反弹后暂停，因为投资者将注意力转移到大型零售商的财报和杰克逊霍尔央行年会，所有这些会议都将在本周晚些时候举行。【原文：U.S. stock index futures wavered on Monday, pausing after a recent rally as investors shifted their focus to earnings from big box retailers and an annual central bank conference at Jackson Hole, all of which are lined up later this week.】

item.title: MCR 酒店集团将通过 27 亿美元的交易将 Soho House 私有化
item.description: 这家会员俱乐部运营商周一表示，以纽约 MCR 酒店集团为首的一批投资者将以约 27 亿美元（含债务）的价格将 Soho House 私有化，这使得其股价在收盘前上涨了 15%。【原文：A group of investors led by New York-based MCR Hotels is taking Soho House private for about $2.7 billion including debt, the members' club operator said on Monday, sending its shares up 15% before the bell.】

item.title: 泰国将为外国游客推出加密货币兑换泰铢服务
item.description: 泰国官员周一表示，泰国将启动一项为期 18 个月的试点计划，允许外国游客将加密货币兑换成泰铢在当地进行支付，这也是振兴该国重要旅游业的努力之一。【原文：Thailand will launch an 18-month pilot programme to allow foreign visitors to convert cryptocurrencies into baht to make payments locally, officials said on Monday, part of efforts to rejuvenate the country's critical tourist sector.】

item.title: 扎克伯格能否在 Meta 隐私集体诉讼案中回避取证？
item.description: 马克-扎克伯格有比出庭作证更重要的事情要做。【原文：Mark Zuckerberg has better things to do than sit for a deposition.】

item.title: 华尔街认为新肥胖药片的价格接近威高维和 Zepbound
item.description: 分析师和投资者称，礼来公司和诺和诺德公司计划明年在美国推出的肥胖症治疗药片的价格很可能与它们的减肥注射剂持平，这与它们不顾降价压力为新药收取更多费用的一贯做法不同。【原文：U.S. prices for obesity-treatment pills that Eli Lilly and Novo Nordisk aim to launch next year likely will be on par with their weight-loss injections, analysts and investors say, in a departure from the usual practice of charging more for new medicines despite pressure to cut prices.】
